singleService.name: Neurology Surgery
singleService.shortDescription: It’s the medical specialty concerned with the prevention, diagnosis, surgical treatment.
singleService.longDescription: Neurological Surgery is a discipline of medicine and that specialty of surgery that provides the operative and nonoperative management (i.e., critical care, prevention, diagnosis, evaluation, treatment, and rehabilitation) of disorders of the central, peripheral, and autonomic nervous systems.

singleService.name: Nephron Kidney
singleService.shortDescription: It’s the medical emergency concerned with the prevention of kidneys, diagnosis, treatment.
singleService.longDescription: Each of your kidneys is made up of about a million filtering units called nephrons. Each nephron includes a filter, called the glomerulus, and a tubule. The nephrons work through a two-step process: the glomerulus filters your blood, and the tubule returns needed substances to your blood and removes wastes.

singleService.name: Medical Test
singleService.shortDescription: A timely health check-up should be undertaken so as to make your future secure from an emergency.
singleService.longDescription: A medical test is a medical procedure performed to detect, diagnose, or monitor diseases, disease processes, susceptibility, or to determine a course of treatment. Medical tests relate to clinical chemistry and molecular diagnostics, and are typically performed in a medical laboratory.Medical tests can be classified by their purposes, the most common of which are diagnosis, screening and evaluation.

singleService.name: Liver Surgery
singleService.shortDescription: A liver resection is the surgical removal of all or a portion of the liver. It is also referred to as a hepatectomy, full or partial.
singleService.longDescription: Liver resection is the surgical removal of a portion of the liver. This operation is usually done to remove various types of liver tumors that are located in the resected portion of the liver.
